title: Autmatic Hate Speech Detection system
description: This study focuses on hate speech detection using a novel ensemble model applied to a bilingual Twitter dataset. The approach involves TFIDF vectorization for feature extraction, considering multiple classification methods (Decision tree, SVC, Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Naive Bayes), and comparing various ensemble combinations. The final ensemble model, combining Support Vector Classifier and Random Forest, achieves an impressive 91% accuracy when tested against the dataset.

title: Named Entity Recognition using Bi-LSTM and Tenserflow Model
description: A study implementing Named Entity Recognition (NER) system using a four-layer BiLSTM model. It automates entity extraction without manual feature engineering, achieving 96.89% accuracy by understanding sentence context through sequential data processing and deep learning techniques.

title: A Review on Grape Disease Detection and Classification using Image Processing
description: This project reviews various image processing and machine learning techniques for detecting and classifying grape plant diseases. It analyzes methods like CNN, SVM, KNN, and deep learning to improve early disease identification, aiding farmers in ensuring better crop health and food quality.
